name: Law Society of Scotland
legal: body established by the Legal Aid and Solicitors (Scotland) Act 1949 as enacted and consolidated by the Solicitors (Scotland) Act 1980.
memberOrga: The Law Society of Scotland represents over 11,000 solicitors in Scotland.
goal: The objectives of the Law Society of Scotland include the promotion of the interests of the solicitors’ profession in Scotland and the interests of the public in relation to that profession.  All practising solicitors in Scotland must be members of the Society and must hold a current Practising Certificate which is issued by the Society.
interests: Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Taxation, Trade
